claimskg.util.handythread module

claimskg.util.handythread.foreach(f, l, threads=3, return_=False)

Apply the function f to each element of the list l in parallel using multiple threads.

Parameters:

  • f (function) – The function to apply to each element of the list.

  • l (list) – The list of elements to apply the function to.

  • threads (int, optional) – The number of threads to use for parallel processing (default is 3).

  • return (bool, optional) – If True, the function will return the results in a list (default is False).

Returns:

If return_ is True, the function returns a list containing the results of applying the function

to each element of the input list. If return_ is False, the function returns None.

Return type:

list or None

Raises:

Exception – If an exception occurs during the execution of the function f on any element in the list.

claimskg.util.handythread.parallel_map(f, l, threads=3)

Apply the function f to each element of the list l in parallel using multiple threads.

This function is an alias for foreach with the return_ parameter set to True.

Parameters:

  • f (function) – The function to apply to each element of the list.

  • l (list) – The list of elements to apply the function to.

  • threads (int, optional) – The number of threads to use for parallel processing (default is 3).

Returns:

A list containing the results of applying the function to each element of the input list.

Return type:

list

Raises:

Exception – If an exception occurs during the execution of the function f on any element in the list.

claimskg.util.indexed_file module

class claimskg.util.indexed_file.FileMappedEmbeddings(path)

Bases: object

An utility class to access word embeddings stored in a file. The file is expected to be in word2vec format, where each line starts with the word followed by its corresponding vector.

Parameters:

path (str) – The file path of the word embeddings.

file

The file object representing the word embeddings file.

Type:

file object

label_index

A dictionary mapping words to their corresponding index in the embeddings file.

Type:

dict

file_start_offsets

A list of file offsets for each word in the embeddings file.

Type:

list

dimensions

The number of dimensions of the word embeddings.

Type:

int

vector(vocab_word

str) -> numpy.ndarray: Get the word embedding vector for a given vocabulary word.

vector(vocab_word)

Get the word embedding vector for a given vocabulary word.

Parameters:

vocab_word (str) – The vocabulary word for which to retrieve the embedding vector.

Returns:

The word embedding vector for the given vocabulary word as a numpy array.

Returns a zero vector if the word is not found in the embeddings file.

Return type:

numpy.ndarray

Module contents

class claimskg.util.TypedCounter

Bases: object

A class that allows counting occurrences of different keys and keeps track of their counts.

Example usage: counter = TypedCounter() counter.count(‘apple’) # Output: 1 counter.count(‘banana’) # Output: 1 counter.count(‘apple’) # Output: 2

counts

A dictionary that stores the counts of different keys.

Type:

dict

count(key)

Increment the count of the given key and return its updated count.

Parameters:

key – The key for which the count should be incremented.

Returns:

The updated count of the given key.

Return type:

int
